title: Renewal of the Covenant
shortSummary: Exodus 34 recounts God's command to Moses to carve new stone tablets after the first were broken, and God’s proclamation of His character and covenant. The chapter emphasizes God's mercy, justice, and the call for Israel’s obedience to His laws as they prepare to enter the Promised Land.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus, during Israel's wilderness journey after leaving Egypt

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader and prophet of Israel who receives God's renewed covenant and commandments on Mount Sinai.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: Moses’ brother and the high priest, who witnesses Moses' radiant face after speaking with God.

definitions.definition: The two stone tablets on which God wrote the Ten Commandments, symbolizing His covenant with Israel.
A description of God’s zeal for exclusive worship, forbidding idolatry and unfaithfulness.
A seven-day festival commemorating Israel’s deliverance from Egypt, marked by eating bread without yeast.
To buy back or rescue, often referring to the practice of redeeming the firstborn animals or sons as belonging to God.

outline.heading: God Commands New Stone Tablets
outline.description: God instructs Moses to carve two new stone tablets like the first, promising to write the covenant words again. Moses obeys and ascends Mount Sinai alone, where God reveals His presence in a cloud.

outline.heading: God’s Proclamation of His Character
outline.description: God proclaims His name and attributes—merciful, gracious, longsuffering, abundant in goodness and truth—highlighting both His mercy and justice. Moses responds with worship and intercedes for Israel’s forgiveness.

outline.heading: Renewal of the Covenant and Instructions
outline.description: God establishes a covenant promising miraculous works and victory over the Canaanite nations, commanding Israel to avoid idolatry and observe specific feasts and laws as signs of their covenant relationship.

outline.heading: Moses’ Radiant Face and Teaching the People
outline.description: Moses spends forty days and nights with God, receiving the covenant laws written on the tablets. His face shines with God’s glory, causing fear among the people, so he wears a veil when speaking to them.

application: Trust in God’s mercy and grace as revealed in His character, knowing He is longsuffering and forgiving toward repentant sinners.
Obey God’s commandments fully, avoiding compromise with worldly influences that lead to idolatry and spiritual unfaithfulness.
Approach God with reverence and humility, like Moses, interceding for others and seeking God’s presence in prayer.
Remember and celebrate God’s deliverance and provision through obedience to His appointed feasts and commands.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, The LORD, The LORD God, merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth,
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the compassionate and gracious nature of God, foundational for understanding His covenant relationship with His people.

keyVerses.text: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of the LORD: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
keyVerses.significance: God promises a powerful covenant with Israel, assuring them of His supernatural intervention and protection.

keyVerses.text: And he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he did neither eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights Moses’ dedication and the divine origin of the Ten Commandments, underscoring their authority.

keyVerses.text: And it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses' hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses wist not that the skin of his face shone while he talked with him.
keyVerses.significance: Moses’ radiant face symbolizes the transformative power of intimate fellowship with God, encouraging believers to seek His presence.
